Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly a belly amphora or olpe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of crest and ear of perhaps a boar with added red on ear, to right; at right, one narrow black vertical band and part of glazed (fired red) handle zone; possible blob as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 454, no. B760)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0090) (Phase 1)
